This did little to reassure you however, as in what felt like seconds the once comforting smile is hidden beneath the veneer of his large gut, bouncing from the recoil of each step and even sooner, one of his paws is above you. You have to dodge out the of way immediately, or you will be becoming very acquainted with that paw...
155212.title: Another patron

choices: Head towards the bar and try to get the giant's attention.
Run for the door and find help elsewhere.
Curl up like a bug on the ground and hope no one stomps on you
1552121.content:
For a moment you could only stare up in awe and tremble as the bulking behemoth entered the bar and strode towards the teeny helpless human in his path. From your flea-sized perspective you could only guess how much larger the colossal beast was compared to your diminished state. His smiling affable face seemed almost godlike and cold as he took no notice to the insignificant pipsqueak who was about to get caught under his heavy-footed tread. Each time those impossibly huge bare paws would smack the ground it sent booming shocks through the wooden floor that made your knees buckle, and in just a few strides the giant had closed the gap between you and the door. You stood still as you saw the colossal bear's paw peeled off of the floor a distance away, before dramatically swinging forward and sailing overhead. Everything seemed to slow down as the shadow of his wide foot was casted over you, you saw the filthy underside of his massive paws in great detail as every bit of dirt and grass that stuck during his walk was on full display overhead. Suddenly realizing where you were about to end up, you finally lost your nerve and started sprinting to the side to avoid your fate as a speck of pawmuck. There was no way you were gonna make it, even as slow as the lumbering beast was he was already dropping his foot towards your puny body and your legs couldn't get you out of his path quickly enough.

THOOOM

Suddenly you were swept up in a gust of wind and pushed violently forward, just as the massive foot of the unwitting titan dropped like a hammer behind you. The force of air being displaced by the giant's careless stomping had just narrowly saved your life. You law back and gasp for air as you stare awestruck at the immense foot of the massive beast who almost just smushed you like an ant. It was at least 100 times longer than your body and caused the floorboards beneath it to groan and creak loudly as his massive weight settled onto it. Then, just as quickly as it had dropped beside you it was lifting off and striding away as the giant took another mighty step. You continued to stare as the gigantic paw lifted off the floorboards beside you and swung forward again, the filthy underside of his foot left a huge noticable dirty pawprint on the tavern floor as he stomped away and sat down heavily at the bar.

Picking yourself up off the floor after that ordeal, you proceeded to...
1552121.title: You dodge by the skin of your teeth

choices: Cautiously start to approach and climb the towering beast.
The clumsy oaf spills his drink.
15521211.content:
You stand up and try to cease the quaking in your legs as you looked towards the very large patron that had just arrived to the bar. You could swear that it knocked the dust loose from the nearby shelves and ceiling boards when he sat down on a large stool and settled his immense weight. You had the immediate instinct to run or hide, but you knew neither of these were good options. Running just meant scurrying around helplessly on the ground until one of these unobservant titans inevitably caught you underfoot, and hiding meant finding a comfortable gap in the floorboards and living off of whatever happened to fall on the floor of the tavern. You glanced at the giant muddy pawprint beside you that dwarfed you in size, and thought of what it would be like trying to live inbetween the floorboards of a tavern with paws this big stomping back and forth overhead all day. No, you were going to have to get one of their attention one way or another, but where to start.

Scanning the tavern from your puny point of view didn't give you much to go off of besides the feet of the patrons. Looking around you saw a lot of different paws, some sat alone and some in pairs. The patrons who were sitting together and conversating weren't good options. They were all too active and fidgety with their paws as they sat, and many were getting up from time to time to walk around. They would often stamp their feet and laugh loudly at each others drunken humor as well. The idea of testing your luck underfoot one of these colossal tipsy bear giants when you've already almost been stomped on was enough to shut the idea down. The blackout drunks also didn't seem like a very good choice though, sure you could climb them if they stay asleep, but how were you going to wake any of them up once you needed them? Besides, you can't guarantee they would even understand what's going on. What if they were so drunk that they just plucked you up and popped you in their mouth like a bar olive when they notice you? No, out of your limited options neither of these seemed very wise.

Then your attention was drawn back to the hulking behemoth that had almost stomped on you earlier. He was still sitting at the bar and it looks like he hasn't moved since settling down. He was sitting rather silently, and he wasn't fidgeting or stomping his feet, at least not enough to really be a threat. The colossus has sat relatively close to you, and you had to crane your neck to see his expression. It seemed that he had been served while you weren't paying attention, he was sipping away what looked like gallons of ale with every gulp from the massive tankard in his grasp. Not seeing much of another option, you started heading across the floorboards towards where the towering patron sat. You scuttled across the floor as fast as you could, passing by each of the wide muddy prints that the behemoth had stamped onto the floor on his way to the bar. After a few minutes you arrived, you were beside the bar and close enough to the gigantic paws of the bear to smell them. The scent of the bears immense paws coated with sweat and earth was indescribably bad, enough to make your eyes water even at a distance. Gazing upwards past the rank paws and huge belly of the beast, you saw the kind smiling face of the patron that had almost squashed you earlier. When you were about to be crushed by him that expression had seemed almost cold and dismissive, now the giant's wide friendly smile was the only beacon of hope in your world of towering beasts and thunderous footfalls. The giant brought a pudgy hand to his king sized gut and clutched it as he took another massive swig of his ale, while you watched below and pondered what to do next...
15521211.title: Back under his shadow

choices: Head upstairs to get some rest
The pandaren is approached by another patron
1552122.content:
Try as you might, you can't force yourself to run from the impending paw, you only just managing to turn to run as the three toed titan makes its descent. Soon the entire sky becomes paw, as the rear of it impacts the floor inches away from you, and you are only able to look up as the large central pawpad descends upon you, sealing you in darkness as your fate beneath this unaware behenmoth is also sealed.

At least, that's what you thought.

The pressure is immense, but manageable as despite the intense heat and darkness you are able to remain in the world of the living - for now anyway. What feels like years pass as the pawpad hugs you tightly before the pressure finally begins to recede. Thank the light, the pandaren is taking his paw off you - finally you can get away and find someone to help you out of this mess. It quickly became clear however, the paw was not finished with its loving embrace.

The paw did rise but with you as a passenger, the thin layer of sweat adhering you to the rough surface of the pawpad as the paw accelerates ever faster with the wooden floor you once called home growing ever more distant. Soon the foot reaches the precipice of its stride and starts to descend once more, leaving you in the uncomfortable darkness once more. The process repeated over and over, seemingly never ceasing and you began to wonder if you would be doomed to be lint stuck to a paw of a gargantuan pandaren for the rest of your life.

As you pondered this, your captor up above was having some much nicer issues to consider. Should he head upstairs to rest his weary paws or grab a few drinks from the bar to rest his grumbling tummy?
1552122.title: Underpaw

15521221.content:
Stuck below the powerful bear paw, it was nigh impossible to tell what the pandaren was planning and in your predicament, you couldn't care less - whatever allowed you to escape your prison sooner and get help worked for you.
Unfortunately, it seemed like the titan was not stopping just yet as the stomping into the floor continued, which despite having some time to grow accustomed to did not become any less uncomfortable to you. You just thanked the light that the worst you had was a few minor bruises and scrapes at this point, but there was no telling when or if your luck would run out.

As the paw started to raise you noticed something was off as the paw was clearly lifting higher than before. Something that the pandaren above probably didn't even notice was a massive hint to you as you looked down to confirm your suspicions. A wooden step, which could only mean one thing. The pandren was heading upstairs to one of the inn rooms, perhaps to get some sleep? You did not know, but you steeled yourself knowing that the end of your ordeal was in sight.

You did however forget one thing, which became immediately apparent as the pandren made his first step up the stairs. Walking up the steps would require him balancing on one paw as he brought is immense frame up to the next step. Again, this was something that was nearly imperceptible to your captor, but something that threatened to break bones or worse if you were unlucky. As the paw came down the pressure was even more immense than usual, so immense that it almost felt like you were about to become one with the paw itself. All the air was squeezed out of your lungs and the pain in your limbs was immense for a few long seconds but you survived as the paw started to raise again. You had survived the first step.

The journey did not get any easier as the odyssey continued, with each step coming dangerously close to breaking something but miraculously being saved at the last second each time. Soon enough, the hardest part was over as the titan made it to the top of the stairs and began to make the last leg of the journey, which while certainly uncomfortable was nowhere near as bad as your ordeal on the stairs and you were thankful to the gargantuan bear for that. It was unusual but you almost had a sense of kinship with your captor, a sort of appreciation for surviving the unusual journey together - even if he was completely unaware of your existence. It was then you remembered that this beast was more than an inanimate paw and just because he was unaware of your plight did not mean he wished it upon you. The pandaren above that was simply that, a pandaren, no matter your difference in size. You just hoped you could get his attention and he could hopefully help you out of this predicament.

As your mind wondered you failed to notice that the pandaren had stopped to open the door to his room, walked in and had shut the door - sealing you in the same room alone with the beast. He took a few more steps before sitting on the base of the bed, it groaning in immense protest beneath his gargantuan frame.

The paw sat just above the floor, resting on its heel and giving you a chance to get a breather if only for a few seconds as the pandaren...
15521221.title: Moving On Up

155212211.content:
As your titanic captor sits on the bed, you're hopeful that the worst of your ordeal is over. The pandaren however, has other ideas.

Stuck to the massive paw of the titan, you have little to do until the vast pandaren decides to head to sleep. It comes to a surprise then, when the light of the room is once again blotted out by something large. Is he getting up again? No, it doesn't look like it. Looking up, you see the large pudgy hand paws heading towards you or at least the feet you're on. While it looks like the pandaren hasn't noticed you specifically, he has noticed the mild irritation you have been causing and he intends to do something about it.

The chubby fingers crash into the ground and start vigorously rubbing against the sole, the loud sound of skin rubbing against skin omnipresent to you. The murring and moaning of the bear rumbles you to your core as you continue in vain to try and escape your fleshy prison but are unable to do so and soon the large rubbing paws are above you, the large surfaces pressing you deep into the pawpad. The process was surprisingly painless, if a little uncomfortable - hells, you even think if the pandaren was aware of your perilous situation you might enjoy it but that would be something to worry about another time.

The pandaren continues to massage the paw and you along with it, pushing you a little deeper into the crevasses of the pawpad and making you smell just a little bit more like paw musk every time he does so. After a few attempts, you realise that you could probably grab onto some of the hand fur to pull yourself from your prison. It isn't without its risks though, as you don't know where the pandaren might be putting that hand next...
155212211.title: Rubbed his aching paws

1552122111.content:
You wait until the pandaren massages his paw once again and attempt to grab onto some of the white fur of his hand before it recoils. Reaching out, you manage to do so just before the hand retreats and are pulled from the paw prison with a *shlorp* and the sweat keeping you stuck to the paw releases you.

Now gripping onto the hand for dear life you can only watch as the hand moves towards...
1552122111.title: Holding onto hope

choices: Retracts his hand and goes to sleep
Gets up - looks like your ordeal isn't over
15521221111.content:
The gargantuan hand moves up through the heavens at a rapid pace, providing quite the sense of vertigo as you hold on for dear life. Your ascent slows however as you near the pudgy midsection of the pandaren, its large girth spilling over a rope belt that clearly looks uncomfortable carrying so much weight. You have to admit, it is almost impressive how large the doughy belly is; it's clear that this pandaren spends a lot of time filling it with delicacies when he gets the chance.

Your mild admiration does not last long however, as the monolithic stomach expands so you can no longer see the curved edges of it. The hand is settling upon the stomach and in no time at all, you are squashed against the belly and the hand. The tummy is soft, much softer than the paw you were previously prisoner to and you can't help but be thankful for that as the stomach bubbles below, almost as if to emphasise how easily the pandaren could add you to it if he wished. The pandaren instead...
15521221111.title: Belly of the Bear

choices: Directly into the yawning mouth of the giant
Directly onto the giant's wide snout
15521221112.content:
You clung for dear life to the Giant's hairy hand as it withdrew from the massive scrunching feet of the Pandaren. Each of the titanic toes on the Pandaren's weary paw flexed farewell to the mite sized human as the hand lazily moved away. All you could do was grip as hard as you can as the Pandaren lifted both legs over and laid his head down onto the lumpy pillow of his inn bed. The entire frame of the bed groaned in protest as the gargantuan Pandaren settled onto the mattress. The trip through the air on the side of the huge clawed hand was terrifying and made worse by the Pandaren settling into bed.

When you got the courage to open your eyes again you saw that you were moving over the fur covered surface of the giant's immense and ever active gut. The impressive rounded paunch of his huge belly steadily moved up and down with the giant's breathing as you were carried past his hairy chest and stopped directly over his huge sleeping face. Your huge unwitting captor's eyes were closed tight, and you could only cling frozen to his hand for safety as the giant's massive maw stretched open directly below you. Your gaze was locked in horror as the wide mouth of the massive beast opened at an agonizingly slow pace. As his jaws and lips parted, you caught the full view as strands of thick saliva stretched and snapped between the bottom and top of his mouth. His teeth glimmered in the dim light his room and his slimy tongue sat underneath you, slick with saliva. As a crumb sized human you couldn't be in a more terrifying position, if you lost your grip and fell into the Pandaren's cavernous mouth he would likely gulp you down without any notice. The hand that you clung to moved ever closer to the giant's widening maw as the sleepy titan started to take a huge yawn. You wish you could cover your ears as the massive mouth below you started to inhale very deeply for a few seconds, the few long strands of saliva still unbroken shook violently and his tongue quivered as the oversized mouth you hung over inhaled with a terrifyingly loud sigh.

Unfortunately for you that was the easy part.

When the huge bear started to exhale in a massive yawn you could only hold on for a few moments before losing grip and being flung off. The gale of hot breath that the Pandaren behemoth unleashed onto you stung your eyes and shook you around as you clung to his hand. The hot and humid wind blew hard on your tiny body and covered you with the beast's spittle. The overpowering breath of the giant beast also carried the unmistakable scent of what it had for lunch, fish and sharp cheese with bread and ale. You didn't want to end up as a small side to what was brewing in this mighty Pandaren's stomach, but you had very little control over what happened next as the blast of hot breath bellowing from his mouth forced you to loosen your grip and fall...
15521221112.title: Over The Yawning Abyss

155212211121.content:
The maw below you only grows larger as the pandaren continues to yawn, massive pools of saliva continuing to form on the undulating tongue, flowing down to the ocean of spittle below you. The sight is only made more terrifying by the large fangs of the bear like creature, standing tall not unlike some of the towers you would find in Stormwind.

The rancid, human air only gets worse too as the mouth continues to spew out stale air at an unfathomable rate. The humid breath has now started to seep into everything in sight, namely your clothes and the fur that you have suddenly become very attached to. Trying as hard as you can, there is little you can do to hold on and soon, the wet fur slides out of your grasp and you descend into the abyss below.

You can only watch as the paw, your final lifeline, grows more and more distant and soon but surely, you crashing into the surface of the saliva ocean. You spit out the warm fluid and immediately try to get your bearings; it seems that you have been deposited onto the tip of the immense tongue. Escape could still be possible if you swim with your might, but you had better hurry - it looks like the panadren is done yawning!

1552122111212.content:
You flail and scream as you fall into the gaping maw of the yawning Pandaren. Your puny body fell past the hot gale of breath that surged from the beast's chops, and straight towards a viscous ocean of spittle that had gathered on the back of the wide quivering tongue. You hit the surface and sunk below, instantly fighting to swim upwards lest you drown in the slobber of the uncaring oaf. Your head broke free of the liquid and gasped for breath, instantly recoiling at the intense foul smelling breath that you sucked in. Gazing upward, you see the tongue that you were on raised upward towards the wide open jaws of the beast. You were uncomfortably close to the back of his throat, and you were going to have to climb vertically on his long slimy tongue to reach the distant lips of the bear. Then you were going to have to somehow get by his huge gnashing teeth, each dwarfing you in size, before exiting through his lips. Not like you were ever going to get the chance however, as the Pandaren was withdrawing his hand from the front of his mouth as the jaws slowly closed and the lips sealed you in. The dim light that was flooding into his open mouth was slowly shuttered out as the wide maw of the beast clamped shut. Sitting in absolute darkness with nothing but the heavy breathing of the sleepy Pandaren to keep you company. Next thing you knew you were tossed into a world of chaos as the giant tossed you around in his tongue as he gathered up all the saliva in his mouth. The unwitting behemoth was going to swallow all of the excess spit in his mouth, and you were going to be swept up alongside it. Without any chance to retaliate, the behemoth gathered you up in the back of his mouth and swallowed you whole.

GLUCK

The Pandaren smacked his lips and smiled as he yawned and scratched his belly. Nothing seemed to beat the pleasure of eating a big meal and then taking a nap, at least not for him. He sighed contentedly as he massaged his big hairy belly, he could feel it was stuffed to the brim and working very hard to digest. He could feel gas starting to build up in his tummy too, and he massaged the spot with a wide open palm until he could feel it shifting towards his throat. He clutched his belly as it expelled the gas and he felt the belch rising.

Mmmm... BUUUUURRRP... Aaahh...

The great chubby oaf sighed in relief as he felt his stomach relax and continue to churn its contents. That burp tasted of fish and cheese, a fact that made him smile as he thought about all of it churning through his innards.

The giant stuffed bear couldn't have ever known about the stowaway in his gut.
The sleepy titan scratched his gigantic stomach and dozed off without any concern for the tiny human that was now trapped in his bowels.

choices: Fight back with all your strength. The little that you possess.
15521221112121.content:
The gentle breeze smelled sweet as you sat outside your favorite cafe in Stormwind. You had a hot cup of tea brewed just the way you like sitting on the table and the sun shone directly over the bustling streets of the city. The scene was absolutely stunning, and for a moment you closed your eyes and let it sink in. You felt so relaxed and peaceful that you could just fall asleep right in your chair without any worries. Nothing could ruin such a perfect day.

That's when you felt it coming. At first a little bit, then a little bit more. Your eyes peeled open and the first thing you noticed was that the streets that were once crowded with active citizenry and commerce were now deserted and dead silent. No signs of anyone even being there. The next thing you noticed was the tea in front of you. Every few seconds the perfectly smooth surface of your drink would jostle and ripple, as if someone was elbowing the table. It kept happening, and you could definitely feel something shaking the ground now, almost as if something really big was...

You were too unnerved to stay idle any longer. You shot up, knocking your chair over in the process and sprinted through abandon streets and alleys towards Stormwind's main gate. That recurring tremor in the ground continues under your feet, and was getting worse each time. It seemed something big was coming.

BOOM

Not just big, gargantuan, and the entirety of the city has left you to fend for yourself.

BOOM


BOOM


BOOM

It was getting difficult to stay on your feet as each passing quake threatened to trip you up, but you gunned it and eventually reached the bridge leading to the main gate.. What you saw in the distance when you got outside the city made you want to run back inside the walls and find as deep a hole as possible to hide in.

Off in the distance, past the bridge and main doors of Stormwind was a behemoth that was taller than anything he had ever seen in all of Azeroth. It was an impossibly massive Pandaren, taller than any surrounding mountain was stomping through the Elwynn Forest towards your fair city. The hulking giant sported an ample gut, and it shook up and down as the beast approached. Each thunderous step was now forcing you to your knees, and more and more of your vision was dominated by the approaching god as it loomed ever closer. Finally you could see the underside of it's massive black bear paws as they crushed everything in their path. The final devastating step from the beast swung forward and dropped directly onto the heavy main door of the city in the loudest crash yet. The reinforced tower walls and gate crumbled like sandcastles under the impossibly heavy weight of the colossal panda's wide sole. The three enormous toes on the giant monster's wide paw settled their weight into the ground as the sole sunk in and left a nice heavy impression, the only escape from the city was now sealed tight under the sole of the massive domineering bear god.

The giant stopped, and your gaze followed the massive foot that was resting where the walls to Stormwind used to be upwards towards the owner. The godlike oaf's wide smile was barely visible beyond the wide curve of his sizable gut. You shuddered as you thought about the fate of your city now. Stormwind was either going to end up smashed under this beast's massive paws or stuffed inside it's greedy belly. The looming behemoth didn't stomp towards the city or slurp it up however. It actually seemed like it was looking down at you, despite the fact that you must be smaller than a grain of rice from the colossal bear's perspective. Your suspicions were dreadfully confirmed as the enormous got onto one knee with a quake and settled his weight onto his foot that stood on the ruins of the gate. The giant's intent stare was focused on you as he leaned down and extended one pudgy hand towards your tiny helpless body. The thought of running wasn't even present in your mind as you submitted yourself to the whims of this towering monster. The shadow of his massive hand cast you into darkness, and light was brought back once you were being (rather gently) pinched between the behemoths thumb and forefinger.

The monster lifted you as he rose back to his full height, and even though you had ridden the griffins plenty of times in your travel nothing could prepare you for the vertigo of being lifted to this towering creature's full height so quickly. The beast raised you past it's gigantic belly which it was now rubbing with an unmistakable eagerness, and in front of the monster's wide snout. The large eyes of the beast were focused on it's tiny catch, and figuring this was your only chance to somehow change the giant's mind you made your bid of screaming your puny lungs out and praying to the heavens. Seems the heavens and the beast weren't going to listen to you however, as maw of the hungry giant slowly opened and his wide slimy tongue came out to lick his chops before his meal. The mouth opened wide, and whatever puny pleas you were shouting at the giant were drowned out as the giant gave a large exaggerated hungry sigh.

Aaaaaaaahhh

Struggling was hopeless, as the massive hungry mouth of the monster eagerly opened you were raised directly over the big slobbery deathtrap. Each massive fang of the monster glistened in the sun, and its tongue shook and stirred in his mouth with anticipation at tasting its tiny snack. Finally, after the cruel giant dangled you there for awhile between its thumb and forefinger, he decided to finally to release you from his grip and gobble you up. You fell past the hot breath of the beast as its widening maw came closer. You fell into the giant's mouth, it's jaws snapped shut behind you and you were enclosed in darkness.

************************

You awoke with a fright as you struggle to grasp your situation. That was all a dream? It was pitch black where you woke up, the ground you were on felt wet and slimy, and by the gods the smell of this place. That's when the events leading up to this hit you like a truck as you remembered everything. Being shrunken and transported to foreign lands, looking for help from the massive and oblivious locals, getting quickly caught underfoot, and then somehow topping that by being unknowingly eaten by the same mammoth sized oaf. That's right, you were the size of a crumb, and you had ended up in this hulking giant's busy stomach. With a bit of elementary magic you manage to illuminate your surroundings, and you almost wish you hadn't.

The inside of the Pandaren's stomach was filled to the brim with its last meal. Large hunks of decomposing bread, half melted bites of cheese and heaps of fish fillet all poorly chewed were stewing in the vast ocean of his grumbling tummy. Looking down you could see that the piece of solid ground that you were standing on was actually a fish head from the beast's meal, swallowed whole and bobbing sideways on the surface of the bubbling chyme. The walls of the stomach were always shifting and mixing the contents of the bear's tummy, and you dropped flat onto the fish head and clung for dear life as they jostled you and threatened to knock you off your only bit of safety and into the churning digestive ocean. The sound of gurgling and deep bowel movements was constant and incredibly loud. The bubbling contents of the bear's digesting meal was loudest of course, but you could certainly hear that lots of food was moving through deeper inside the bowels of this beast too. By the time this behemoth gets up his stomach will be empty too, and it was almost certain that he was going to be stuffing it full again as soon as he woke from his slumber. You were gonna be a small part of that, a very small part of that. Stuffed in between one big meal and the next, you were gonna be packed in like another tiny morsel and pushed with his food all the way through his guts. What was even going to be left of you when you come out the other side?

“At least Stormwind is safe.” You thought as you clung for purchase and considered your fate. The same giant that obliviously stomped on you and tracked you to his bedroom on the bottom of his paw had also managed to unwittingly swallow you whole. Now you were just another bit of protein that was going to be mixed in with the rest of his meal.
